review_title: Working at Eastman as a Lab technician for more than two years, I feel happy and enjoy myself there.
pros: The working environment is relaxed at Eastman and you won't feel highly pressured there. Eastman's culture and values to make you have a balance of work and life is what I appreciated.
cons: I think Eastman should have more Chinese technical or commercial files not only for internal use but also for our local customers to have a better understanding for our business,

review_title: A work environment that allows balance between family and career while providing learning and development opportunities.
pros: Eastman Chemical Chemical allows you to be creative within your job responsibilites and expects high performance from all employment levels. Multiple area retail discounts are available to Eastman Employees
cons: Our technology updates do not move as quickly as expected from a large company.  The IT department is not familiar with all devices only the ones that are standard issue.

review_title: Lots of opportunity at a great place to work.
pros: Flexible hours, endless opportunities for lateral or vertical movement, and a good team oriented culture.  Eastman constantly preaches on the safety of their people which is nice.  Eastman is very active in the local United Way activities which really helps with community involvement.
cons: Eastman is still somewhat "old school" in terms of time-off policies.  Also, the move to further aline with Affordable Care Act health policies feels like health coverage has been negatively affected somewhat; however this is the direction all companies are moving in.

review_title: Eastman is a great company that offers challenging and diverse assignments and outstanding colleagues.
pros: Eastman strives to be a winner and is committed to constantly improving, innovating and growing sustainably without compromising its ethics or caring culture.
cons: Eastman's headquarters in East Tennessee are more small town than metropolitan and some find that to live there happily family, the outdoors, no traffic and little crime have to be a priority.

job_title: Market Development Manager in Kingsport, TN
pros: Best in class processes in a highly collaborative team environment drive excellent decision making and business success.  Investing for growth through innovation and as the company grows there are expanding technology platforms from which to innovate.
cons: Sometimes can be too collaborative with too many meetings.  The East Tennessee area takes some adjusting to if you come from a major city.  However, low tax rates, no crime and no traffic with beautiful surroundings are positives.

pros: Eastman is a great company to work for. There is room for growth, the company is very secure and constantly growing in many areas. Your safety is their priority.  The people that I work with are pleasant, helpful and always respectful. I imagine I will be with Eastman for many years to come.
cons: Healthcare coverage should be better than it is.

pros: Great people to work with for the most part who care about doing a good job.
cons: I have been with Eastman for many years. For the past few years, top leadership within the company continues to push changes and emphasize performance in a way that clearly indicates the bulk of the workforce does not seem to be valued. Lately there has been a push to emphasize certain HR policies in such a way that there is increasing division across a very large part of the workforce. It is getting increasingly difficult to specially recognize top talent which causes those folks to be disappointed. The obvious focus is a sustained short term strategy to get the stock price up which is something most people definitely desire. In years past, we have attracted lots of professional talent from higher paying jobs in part because they wanted out of a culture that Eastman is now trending towards. One effect is to make it much easier for someone to leave Eastman and go to another employer, since we are losing the culture advantage. A watch out - looking through some other reviews and based on my experience I think that there are quite a few fakes. Also, the company has strongly encouraged employees in the past to do a review on glassdoor.

review_title: Was a Great Company - Future is Uncertain
pros: The company provide the opportunity for good technical challenges.  Generally good people.  Ethical employees and management.  Positive work enviornment until recently.
cons: New performance rating system with a forced bottom 5% is destroying moral and workplace culture. Promotions have slowed down dramatically in the last 3 years.  Flat budgets are impacting hiring and raises.

pros: I had some of the best coworkers here whom truly believe in teamwork to be successful!!
cons: Unfortunately there are several types of employees at every workplace that you have to turn the other cheek and just do your job to the best of your ability. Treat others as you want to be treated!

pros: You get an initial good impression from the place, but this being the south, you will realize that it's only skin deep.
cons: It seems like you can't go far at this place without finding numerous people who feel like they got screwed by management for one reason or other.  That's some combination of southern culture demanding every thing be 'good' and the inability, or lack of desire, to actually address real management issues.

pros: Good Salary and Benefits. You can get lucky and have good group leader.
cons: No courage to innovate. Some regions has a very bad working enviroment. I have seen Collegues being bulled infront of Directors and no actions was taken.  The less you work the best employee you are.  There is no work ethics.

review_title: A formerly decent company in its death spiral.
pros: Lack of priorities or focus areas result in a pretty long rope to do whatever it is you think you need to be doing to keep your unit running.
cons:
Eastman as a company fundamentally does not know what it wants to be.  Investors can't tell either which is why our stock price has been all over the place since we began our journey to be a "specialty" chemical company.  One thing that is clear is that we are a cost cutting company.  The last few years have been nothing but one cost reduction initiative after another.  If we do not cut cost then we will be bought out.  Same story year over year.  Many of those initiatives end with positions being cut.  Now that we've cut most of what we can at current facilities, we're outsourcing what is left to India.  

The performance management system implemented over the past few years is a forced ranking system.  Company PR personnel will respond to Glassdoor reviews trying to argue the opposite but its true.  You can meet or even exceed your goals but at the end of the day you will have no idea what to expect until you are told what bucket you made it into.  On top of that you are judged not just by what you accomplish but also on a buzz-word list of behaviors.  It is no wonder so many people have left the professional ranks over the past 2 years.  It is more important that you fit the Eastman mold than actually contribute to the bottom line.

At a site level there is continual communication on focusing on what is truly a priority.  What is missing and has been for some time is what the priorities truly are.  This has created an environment of frustration and boredom.  People end up working on what they think is important or nothing at all.  We are consistently told to push back on management and coach up when we believe something isn't right or that we are going in the wrong direction.  Do so at your own peril. You will be labelled a resister of change and it'll come back to bite you on your "Behaviors" section of the performance review.

pros: Eastman Chemical is a good company that provides good pay for the area in east Tennessee. I work with a great work family and enjoy a flexible work schedule.
cons: Unfortunately some of the health benefits appear to be declining in what they offer. It also seems at times that the business is becoming less family oriented and more focused on doing whatever it takes to make a buck even if that means at the expense of their employees.

review_title: Best place to work, best city to live, period!
pros: Everyone is friendly and helpful.  It seems other than making money, management is most interested in developing its employees.  The companies businesses are diverse and not dependent on a single economic factor.  Work/life balance is great!
cons: By locating in a smaller city, we don't have all of the high-end restraurants and stores.  There are not a lot of comparable jobs in the region which means if you want a change you are likely required to move physically.

review_title: Overall great company to work for
pros: Recognition for good performance where warranted, challenging opportunities, reasonable security - a way to make a real difference for others at Eastman as well as customers.  Colleagues that care and are willing to assist others to be their very best.  Excellent executive leadership for last few years.
cons: Traditional - slow to change; somewhat risk adverse.  Aging demographics and talent pool restriction (given headquarters geography).

review_title: Culture is changing to a less personal workplace.
pros: Friendly people at Eastman.  Top people are rewarded as well as people who play the game well.  Training and other resources are normally available.  The company seems to be doing well.
cons: Management is not clear on what your expectations are and not really honest with you on where you stand.   Some of the companies success has come at the employees expense.

pros: The company culture is very collaborative and people are willing to help.  The size of the company affords good career growth opportunities for even those who are experienced.  The location is great, especially if you enjoy the outdoors. I like the opportunities to get involved in community activities too.
cons: The company is complex and it takes some time to learn and feel you have a solid understanding the products.

review_title: The company is paranoid about everything and has way too many attorneys and legal holds.
pros: The people in the most part work well together and are very productive.  The company does give the necessary resources to allow the employees to do their jobs.
cons: The management, Director level and above, all change jobs every 12-14 months and each time they seem to get promoted to a higher level. There are way too many levels of management from top to bottom.

review_title: Good place to grow your career.
pros: Eastman is a growing organization with a track record of success.  The employees work hard and genuinely care about the success of each other and the organization.  There is a great deal of passion and loyalty for the organization - more than I've seen at other employers I've been with.
cons: The area is a beautiful and people are very friendly.  The location, however is somewhat remote and travel to/from can be difficult.

review_title: Good place to work...with some challenges
pros: co-workers really care about each other; work together to get job done.  stable company with good history.
cons: most management has a "better than you" attitude.  raises & bonuses medicre at best; except leadership team - they're bonuses are more than most make in a year.  new employee health benefits are awful.

pros: Eastman has good pay. Eastman is focused on protecting the enviroment they are very focused on being good neighbors in the community.
cons: Changing Benefits and Retirement. The benefits have changed several times in the 20+ years I have been here and the price keeps going up while the benefits go down.

review_title: Great Pride in what Eastman stands for and World Class Products
pros:
Eastman management cares about its people and their carreers, all employees get ample of opportunities to demonstrate their potential and the reward system is solid and thoughtful.
The recent integration of the Solutia acquisition is done with great care to maximize the benefits.
cons: Sometimes to much burocracy which is taking the speed out of the decision making process. The good thing is that senior mangement is aware and is working the issue.

review_title: Colleagues are constantly collaborating with and supporting each other.
pros: The people you work with are intelligent and kind. The problems you work on are challenging and require you to test your intellect to solve. Coworkers are willing to discuss and work through things by sharing their own problem solving thoughts and past experience.
cons: Kingsport is small town that is poorly laid out. The company has yet to present a real downside. The minor inconveniences of required paper work are about as minor as can be reasonably be expected though there is room for improvement.

review_title: I have been treated fairly and compassionately in every work function to which I have been assigned.
pros: Eclectic mix of local and “imported” employees make Eastman a very diverse company.  Management seems to value exceptional employees and promote to show that value.
cons: After almost 37 years with Eastman, if I had not been well satisfied in my employment, I would have found another job.  I can think of no downside to working here.

review_title: It's great to be part of a winning team.
pros:
Company culture is constructive. Eastman tends more to maximize an employees strengths than hammer them to improve their weaknesses. 
Eastman offers a very diverse array of career opportunities.
Success of our growth initives should assure even more opportunity for professional and personal growth, as well as, job security.
cons:
Decision making tends to be slow.
The growing harshness of the personnel capability assessment process will threaten the constructive culture we've had.

review_title: I have been with Eastman for many years and have had a very satisfying career so far.
pros: Great people, strong opportunities for growth, very positive culture in the company.  Also you can move into many different roles in the organization without having to relocate as there is a high concentration of many different types of jobs at headquarters.
cons: Small town environment can be a challenge at times.  Also, it's helpful (but not required) to have a technical degree.

pros: Eastman is a company that still cares about its employees and is not afraid to show it.  The people are open, friendly and helpful.  The work enviornment is good and the company promotes safety and employee health. I enjoy the work I do and it feels as if it's important to the overall organization. I feel l have promotional opportunities if I perform well.
cons: Parking and the amount of collaboration sometimes makes things feel as if they are moving slow.

review_title: It's a great company that offers great work/life balance
pros: You'll find many high-quality individuals that are truly team-oriented and you don't tend to work with many people who are only out for themselves.
cons: The promotions tend to be few and far between. The benefits continue to get worse over time. Pay is not as good as you would find at some other employers.

pros: Although I've heard it wasn't always this way, the current Eastman culture is warm and inviting.  It really is a pleasure to work with people who are kind, considerate, competent, humble... the list goes on and on.  Compensation is far above what fellow college alums have shared with me, and to me that's a tangible reinforcement that Eastman highly values their employees and desires to keep them for years.
cons: Insufficient documentation of past projects can be frustrating at times, but that's to be expected with a 60-year-old plant.

pros: I think in general they take care of people, and it's a good place to stay in one place and make a career.
cons: The culture feels very fake and insincere, basically turning the word "safety" into a cliche buzzword.  I'd say I average 20 hours of meetings a week (and my boss is closer to 30 hours), where very few decisions are actually made.

pros: The best part about Eastman is the people.  I love coming to work every day and working with some of the smartest and kindest people I know.  I am challenged every day in my job, and I am constantly learning.  Eastman cares about my work-life balance.
cons: Eastman is located in a small town, so it's not always the most exciting place to be.  Also, Eastman's communication can be slow.

pros: Good money, Training is good but could be better
cons: Management breathing down your neck. No room for errors or you will be wrote up and reviewed for termination with little recourse. Strict culture which can be unnerving. Watch out for other employees. They will throw you under the bus if it gets them ahead.

review_title: Balance between work and family is important.
pros: I am able to work part-time to allow me to spend more time with my children and have received promotions while doing so.  Eastman understands the importance of family and encourages a good balance between family and work.
cons: In trying to "be like everyone else" in regards to compensation packages, Eastman doesn't stand out anymore and it may result in losing some possible excellent employees.

pros: Very well organized company, invests in technology and people development. Solid in its traditions and high standards, is willing to risk and change with markets. Great multicultural and modern environment.
cons: At times too traditional, vision and leadership could be stronger and more convincing. Company mission not always clear.

pros: Have worked at EMN for many years and slowly climbed through the ranks by delivering more than the results expected. Full accountability which keep things transparent.
cons: EMN is becoming a lot more political than practical. Need to take more risks and learn quickly from the mistakes. Very slow progression.

pros: Extremely competitive pay, very flexible, and the culture is great. At Eastman your job is treated as though it is your job and not your life. A work/life balance is very important to the culture of Eastman.
cons: It's a chemical plant so it doesn't always smell like roses.

pros: Eastman is an innovative company with a focus and commitment to growth for all stakeholders.  Collaboration and a "can do" attitude are hallmark's of Eastman's culture.  Challenging work environment and world class colleagues in many disciplines.  Strong management team.
cons: Intensity and pressure in the work environment is very high given the competitive industries where we participate and a drive for excellence.

pros: Attitudes are great.  Everyone wants to help everyone, corporate down.  Compensation is great for the area.  Very little turnover.  Company is willing to spend money to invest back in it's sites.
cons: Nothing much to speak of. Overall it really is a great place to work.  Some of the facilities are rather old but there are plans to replace and improve them.

review_title: We're family, we care for each other, from the CEO to the people in the field. The concern is genuine, you can fell it.
pros: Caring atmosphere and culture. Great attuides, from management down. A very safe place to work, where safety is tought as a personal and corporate value. A company full of friends that help each other out. The work atmosphere is one where you can grow and you are challenged to be the best.
cons: No Cons at this time.

job_title: APR Product Management and Planning Specialist in Shanghai, Shanghai
pros: A multinational global company focus on sustainable growth , superior value and innovation to drive a specialty chemical company. I like Eastman culture and humanized working environment which let the employee fast grow with the company grows together..
cons: following more people join the company to support the growth, looking forward more efficient organization chart to work more efficient.

review_title: Great people--some of the best I've ever worked with
job_title: Marketing and Innovation in Kingsport, TN
pros: Strong culture--focus on employees and customers. A very fair company with minimal internal politics. Senior leadership works very well together and provide strong alignment for the rest of the company. Focus on growth and innovation and developing strategies driven by market insights. Growth strategy is exciting--innovation, M&A, organic growth are all very positive for the company.
cons: Location--smaller town setting, 250K people in the regional area. limited diversity, although this is changing as Eastman continues to steadily hire professionals from other locations and other countries.

pros: Organizational values, specifically the quality of life they focus on for employees.  The organization values individuals, and wants to see you succeed, but not at the cost of your family life.
cons: Ultra conservative culture, which can be challenging to navigate.  Additionally, it can cause a mindset of 'we don't do that here', which can also be challenging to navigate.

review_title: A rewarding, family-like place to work.
job_title: Process Improvement Engineer in Kingsport, TN
pros: Eastman has a culture with safety at the forefront and collaboration not far behind.The work is decent, the hours are fair, but the people are great. Everyone is so friendly and ready to help each other it really makes things go quickly and things just seem to get done.
cons: The smells aren't great and the location is less than ideal, but for a chemical company not much better can truly be expected.

job_title: Chemical Plant Operator in Longview, TX
pros: I get paid a handsome hourly rate to maintain a chemical plant as an operator.  They have a true focus on safety that is not hypocritical or false.  Coming from working on the drilling rigs in texas, this job is a dream come true.
cons: Shift work can be hard on family life.  The insurance is not the best, but not terrible, somewhere around mediocre.

review_title: Not the same sane place where I started
pros:
People that you work with on projects day to day are top notch
Interesting projects from a technical perspective
Conservative approach has enabled weathering of economic downturns
cons:
So many processes constrain ability to be innovative
No attention to recognizing individual's strengths to take advantage of them
Focus on being busy with activities over doing something useful and insightful

review_title: Strong growth company that can be more efficient
pros: Growth driven company that derives value from innovation related earnings growth, not cost cutting earnings growth.
cons: As with every big company occasionally you run into red tape and inefficiencies.

review_title: Politicians wanted, good scientists need not apply
pros: If you like small town life, short commute time,  the outdoors, and being close to the mountains, Kingsport is a great place to live.
cons: Eastman is not as ethical as advertised.  Promotions are given based looks, how well you bow to upper management, and whether you are put on the magical “chosen one” list in your first couple of weeks on the job.  There is truly a “chosen one” list, yet no one can seem to explain how the “chosen ones” are identified.  There's no way it can be based on talent given that they are chosen before it is possible to evaluate their skills.  It must be based on looks; just take a look at the leadership team.  Oh and how about ethics for a company that notices Glassdoor rankings are dropping and fluffs the numbers instead of actually addressing the real problems within the company?  Just take a look at the groupings of the 5 star ratings that come out clumped together.  Hmmm, are selected employees' being bribed to put in positive rankings?  Eastman is also a top heavy company.  We just went through a round of layoffs and rather than purge from the top, the talented, harder working, higher salaried non management employees were targeted.

review_title: A challenging, energetic, and fair place to work for an entire career.
pros:
Culture of treating employees with respect, fairness, and gratitude cultivates teamwork and superior results.
Growth focus that requires high-level performance on assignments that are challenging and fullfilling.
cons: It's a global corporation, that requires a multitude of corporate processes.  There are always times when you feel things could move faster/cheaper for better results and value.

review_title: Eastman is still a place where you can spend your entire career in a challenging manner with satisfaction and reward
job_title: Manager Market Insight and Strategy in Kingsport, TN
pros: Eastman is first class with managment that listens to employees and cares.   We are provided all the tools we need to offer customers differentiated services that exceed their expectations
cons: While there are always a few people that  we'd like to change, overall,  Eastman has the values and behaviors in a company that we aspire to work with and for.

review_title: A great company to work for, a culture full of colaboration to meet common goals
pros:
Personal Development Opportunities
High ethical standard
Responsible Care for Employees and Neighbors
The company is becoming more global and drives the efforts to become a Specialty Chemicals Company, which is a great time for most employees.
cons:
Currently none that comes to my mind.
The company is changing a lot recently, which makes the communicaction to all levels quite a challenge, but so far so good.

review_title: A great place to work with an ideal work culture.
pros: Benefits are great, people treat you with respect, the salary is on the high-end, and the company makes sure that you get a chance to learn more about the company as a whole, not just your specific area/ postion.
cons: With a company so big, it can be difficult to figure out who you need to talk to in order to get something done. Also, people are moved around a lot, and experience and information is lost and sometimes experiments are unneccesarily repeated.

review_title: Best company I have worked for
pros: Great pay, great benefits, wonderful and friendly people to work with, flexible work schedule.  By far the best company I have worked for.
cons: I do not have any cons to working here other than the safety concerns which you know coming into working at a place like Eastman.  I feel the PROS definitely way out the CONS.

pros: Paycheck. That's about it.
cons: The company used to be great to work for until they brought in new management. Now all the company does is look to make your work life miserable. Monongahela is one of very few to be union, but you would never know because everyone is against each other. The people will kiss the companies butt,then turn around and lie to their union members on how they hate management. Its a kindergarten here.

pros: Good pay. Good hours. Okay management. Average health care benefits.
cons: Retirement benefits have dwindled down to nothing for new hires. I was fortunate to be one of the few left who received lump sum payments and plus had my 401K. Now they have nothing but what they save and no medical benefits.

pros: Cost of Living. Scenic Mountains. Descent Climate.
cons:
Extravagantly Top-heavy.
Lack of Meritocracy; Poor Treatment of Diversity; No Motivation for Change. 
Hypocritely Nice - Passive Aggressive Attitude Highly Credited.

I met too many honest and talented "Local" people while working at EMN especially in technology and production.  I empathize their worries about future and would like to exclude them from my criticisms here. 

That being said, the "Local" elites rule this company and toxicate the culture by placing unskilled and/or spineless people in the middle management. Generally, there is not any clear metric for a manager's performance anyways. There are project leaders or directors who have no clue about their portfolio and/or skills they manage. At EMN, you may keep asking yourself, why is this guy here? and What does s/he really do? Before I left EMN, I started to speculate that these people must have simple missions like KGB/FBI agents who profile and collect information about the others. Unfortunately, I failed to find any other rationale..
If you join the club and "liked" by the right people, you can survive with  simple responsibilities given to you such as being a meeting facilitator. I am not kidding - such roles exist, for example,  at Corporate Technology!

The saddest story is that there are decision-makers in this company who are extremely incapable and reluctant to give any (useful) directions to their workers, while proudly acting skeptical and critical on any recommendation brought to their attention.

There is also a silly myth going on in the company that if you have  an "analytical" or a "driver" type of social style, you tend to get things done correctly. This is a tiny example of how the passive aggressive culture is justified among people. Honesty and Sincerity are usually blacklisted and not found welcome (or normal). Unnecessary questions and vague criticisms are, on the other hand,  always welcome.

It is hard to operate productively in this culture, as  you cannot catalyst any innovation with a positive attitude. You will be labeled as an optimist or a radical. 

I  have not even mentioned the situation of skilled immigrant labor, who are generally sidelined and given little to no responsibility until resolving the residency situation. I also heard that some people make fun of them in the "club"  gatherings.

Again, for the good of Local and Honest workers and the region, this company should be purchased by a Bigger Peer and get trimmed from the top by the new parent. I do not see any other sustainable solution.

pros:
Freedom to do your job your way, there is no micromanagement and a lot of autonomy from an early stage of starting here.
invests in learning
quick to take products to market, keeping work interesting
cons:
top heavy organisation with slow career progression
old mindset in terms of reward and recognition
bit isolated from the talent market and what the market needs

job_title: Integrated Global Supply Chain in Capelle
pros: For people like myself that like challenges, change and opportunities Eastman is a great place to work. The one thing that remains constant is change. The values on ethical behavior, transparency and sustainabiltity defined as planet, people and profit make it a company of choice for me.
cons: Employees that give more than is required and spend a lot of their descretionary time to achieve results are often taken for granted, it almost becomes an expectation to continuously do this rather than in defined periods of time.

review_title: I never thought it was possible to be so happy at my workplace.
pros: The environment is wonderful. Everyone is so friendly and helpful for both new and experienced employees alike. There is strong emphasis on training and developing a broad skillset. Schedules are also flexible, and management is understanding when real-life situation arise. Along these same lines, work/life balance is much better than many other competitive companies.
cons: As with any large-scale company, career advancement can be a challenge. Lateral movement is often the only means of changing responsibilities and positions.

review_title: "Thankful to work for this Great Company."
pros: Offers potential growth for each individual, personally challenging you to continually strive to be better. Gives you a feeling that YOU are a part of the sucess of the Company. Also it is comforting  to be a part of a Company that cares about the well being of not just its Employees, but cares about the surrounding area and its Customers.
cons: Overall a great Company to work for, but the Health Care Benefits need to be better for the employees and Retirees.

job_title: Human Resources Generalist in Kingsport, TN
pros: Eastman offers a true culture of caring, for its people, and the communities in which they operate.  Colleagues are met with smiles and cordial greetings as they walk the facilities.  Benefits are highly competitive, and integrity is evident from the top of the organization to the bottom.  Upper management is highly visible, and have set forth a clear, strategic vision for the organization.
cons: Lacks significant brand recognition outside of the regions with operations facilities, making recruitment of top talent a significant challenge.

review_title: A very interesting and rewarding place to work.
job_title: IT Contractor in Saint Louis, MO
pros: For the IT field, this company really keeps you busy, always have projects in different stages of completion, never without a project to work on.
cons: Data center and main network node are top notch while most older buildings make do with old outdates equipment. This hampers the facilities productivity at times.

pros: Eastman is an ethical and responsible company, and leadership really cares about employees' best interests. Eastman is also involved in many community partnerships at its sites all over the world. The working environment on the whole is supportive rather than overly competitive.
cons: The region where the corporate headquarters is located lacks racial and cultural diversity. Also, there's a bit of a glass ceiling for hourly employees to become salary.

pros: Good job with quite a bit of flexibility.  If you are intelligent and a self started you can be heavily involved in a lot of projects.
cons: If you try really hard to slack and get very little done - it is totally possible.  People in same role sometimes have MUCH lesser responsibilities.

pros: Safety is becoming a real core value at Eastman. Even in tough economic times safety is not compromised. A real family atmosphere is developing where everyone watches out for each other. This has all greatly improved over the last 37 years I have worked at Eastman. Everyday we are challenged to improve and given the opportunity to do so in safety, work, quality and cost savings.
cons: I never got a chance to get 6 weeks of vacation like some people have.

job_title: Senior Chemical Engineer in Texas City, TX
pros: Good 401k plan with lots of options. Many insurance plans available for dental, vision, and medical.
cons: Salaries are not competitive for the area. Lack of flexibility in working from home and work hours. Salaries for females are not comparable to male counterparts. High cost of medical coverages and deductibles are super expensive.

pros: Eastman has done the hard and dirty work to improve its business portfolio and therefore its financial position. It is still a good place to work due to the teamwork emphasis and quality of the the people. Necessary change is coming, but this is still a great place to work.
cons: Being a conservative company is a good thing in terms of stability and ethics. That does make some things more slowly in relation to other companies.

review_title: Good leadership and career growth in a challenging, but inspiring team environment
pros:
Visionary and competent leadership
Broad capabilities in technology platforms and customer engagement
Committed to talent development and retention; significant investment in employees
Individuals are highly capable and ethical
On journey to transform to more of a specialty company
cons:
As a result of the transformation to more of specialty company, the pressure and stress can by high on individuals trying to drive this change
Pace of decision making can be slow due to concensus and team approach

job_title: Integrated Global Supply Chain in Kingsport, TN
pros: For over 35 years, Eastman has provided me with a multitude of challenging positions across the globe.  No matter where our travels have taken us, we always knew that Eastman valued not only what we did, but how we did it.  Ethics, safey, community and high technical statndards were givens.
cons: We have a Company culture that always delivers and as such we don't tolerate excuses or failures.

pros: The employees have a strong work ethic with a focus on working safely.
cons: As seems to be a trend across the industry, benefits have declined over the years. Ultimate insurance costs for the employee continues to rise while compensation for the average employee seems to struggle to keep up with the escalating cost of living.

job_title: Business Organization Specialist in Kingsport, TN
pros: I enjoy working at Eastman because of the diversity in opportunities and culture.  I've worked here for 7 years and have had the opportunity to work three different positions.  All in which I have learned a lot.  The majority of Management likes to see you grow and learn which gives you the option for change.
cons: In my personal opinion the only con is the benefit changes we have experienced in the past 7 years.  It's been difficult to try and keep track of.

pros: Company provides excellent information to employees about the business and our role in driving value.  Walks the talk in terms of ethics and responsibility...and is the first company I have been with that really lives it's mission statements.
cons: As many have noted, the Company is very "Kingsport-centric".  Through no fault of any individual, it is almost cultish and is hard to break into the inner circle unless you are located there.

job_title: Supply Chain Supervisor in Kingsport, TN
pros: Great company to work for.  They provide lots of opportunity for movement within the company both nationally as well as internationally.  Culture is one of teamwork and everyone working together to provide a good result.
cons: There are some areas which don't necessarily follow the Eastman culture.  This likely has to do with leadership in some areas -- probably not un-like many companies.

review_title: Decent company that is slowly changing
pros: Good support for training and providing tools to get the job done. Plenty of travel opportunities to interact with customers and overseas colleagues.
cons: Mature portfolio of products, labored innovation process and reaction from competitors will hinder the CEO's goal to morph the company into a genuine specialty chemical company.

review_title: Stay away, not worth your time!
pros: Decent, hard working employees that for the most part are fully committed to the company. Unfortunately management will not reciprocate, either in terms of raises orpromotions.
cons:
*Grossly mismanaged from the top down. 
*Not giving freedom to new recruits to develop their talents. 
*Management is enamored with processes over results.
*Employees are expendable when the first economic downturn hits. 
*Old fashioned mentality in doing business, and squeezing employees, suppliers and customers, until they have nothing else to give.

pros: Great committment to safety, environment, and employee well-being, while not losing focus on continuous financial success. The company had to make very tough business decisions over the last few years to exit some businesses while expanding in others...the success and growth over the last 10 years has not been by accident.
cons: Having to comply with the new health care laws and facing unprecedented EPA regulations.

review_title: Eastman is a very solid place to work
pros: Has committed to large investment in Kingsport site and corporate office, provides decent benefits and encourages wellness amoung employees and families
cons: Eastman is a rather large corporate presense, especially in a small town like Kingsport.  It can be difficult to understand who to deal with in other parts of the company, but most employees are very helpful.

review_title: One of the best companies to work for
pros: Eastman values their people and talent and spends a lot of effort to encourage them to grow and learn and bring new insights to become a true Specialy Chemical Company
cons: The head office is located at Kingsport, which is a small town. If you like the life of a big city you may not like this place. But, the small city offers a lot of other perks that you do not get in a big city.

pros: At Eastman, everyone is here to help.  You will not find a place with nicer coworkers, or a friendlier executive team.  There is also a lot of room for growth within the company.
cons: The location of the corporate headquarters can deter talent.  Although there is more youth entering the company, the average age is still well above that of other companies.

review_title: Eastman continues to grow in the right way.
pros: Eastman values growth with customers and leverages strengths of its employees.  In addition, Eastman values the communities we live and operate in.  Eastman is a unique place that values work-life balance and giving back to the community.  A very collaborative culture that likes to win.
cons: As the company gets larger, it needs to work hard to build on the strength of its culture while being flexible to adapt to the competitive landscape.

review_title: Great place to be a part of a team
pros: Invests in development, lots of processess and experience to support employees as they navigate the company.  Easy culture to assimlate too -- everyone is helpful and wants to be involved on projects.
cons: Highly matrixed, so it can be slow to make decisions.  Striving to be more global, but HQ still runs most decision making. Looking to develop KEY talent, but seems to internal message the need to acquire talent to fill gaps at lower and senior levels.

job_title: Senior Research Chemist in Kingsport, TN
pros: Strong emphasis on growth and rewarding those who take risks.  Sense of urgency (that's a good thing) in many pojects and it has a good diversity of people and team players to work with.
cons: The overall culture is positive but not everyone shares the grand vision for change nor adapt to it, too bad for them.

review_title: Friendly coworkers and relatively stress-free atmosphere with somewhat disappointing compensation.
pros: The company has a very good work environment.  Coworkers are friendly, approachable, and helpful.  There is a good work/life balance with most managers understanding you have a life outside the office.
cons: The pay seems to be lower than the industry average especially considering the site's close proximity to Houston.

job_title: Advanced Mechanical Engineer in Kingsport, TN
pros: Eastman is a highly diverse company with endless opportunities.  Salary is competitive.  Work load is both reasonable and enjoyable.  Management here is great and colleagues are people that I want to hang out with.
cons: Not looking forward to a high deductible health care plan but I guess that is what everybody is going to eventually.

review_title: Great place to work and grow!
job_title: Integrated Global Supply Chain in Kingsport, TN
pros: The people are the best thing about working at Eastman! It's a supportive network that will help you learn and grow throughout your career. They genuinely care about your development. Ethical Chemical company isn't an oxymoron here. There's a big emphasis on safety and the sustainability movement is growing.
cons: It seems to be difficult to attract diversity to the area, where more than 95% of the Tri-Cities area consists of non-hispanic whites.

pros: Very positive working environment, excellent prospects for advancement across businesses, forward-looking management, strong technical competencies, seen as a valuable business partner with customers
cons: Still quite a bit of the old boys network in existence, but decreasing little by little.  Healthcare costs are increasing and we are feeling it, especially with the "consumer driven healthcare plans"

review_title: Global opportunities with a small town quality of life
pros:
Global opportunities with a specialty chemical company
Strong focus on teamwork and process excellence
Year over year performance - in it for the long haul
Consistently hear from peers that Eastman has the "best people"
cons:
Very conservative, especially regarding risk management
Small town is hard to recruit, but if you come, you'll never want to leave

pros: Capable management who have steered us to steady growth.  I believe the company tries to balance the needs of employees, profits and the environment and do the right thing.  As employees we are given the right tools to do their job right.  We are located in a small city with low crime, low traffic and a low cost of living.
cons: Do not expect rapid growth or advancement as we are a stable and large company that rarely takes bold big steps.

review_title: Eastman has been fair to me as an employee encouraging me to grow myself intellectually and rewarding me for doing so.
pros: Good pay, good benefits, good people.  I love my job!  My supervision helped me find the job that I was best for.  They want you to succeed, for when you do the company does.
cons: There is no downside.  If you work hard and you are honest and upbeat you succeed.

review_title: I have continued to improve and grow professionally with my experience at Eastman
job_title: Human Resources Benefits in Kingsport, TN
pros: Eastman is very disciplined and makes significant decisions with a long term focus.  This has put the company on a growth path and is creating opportunities for employees to potentially grow with the company.
cons: The culture at Eastman is a collaborative one, that can at times slow down decision making and make the pace of change slow.

pros: Eastman has a very strong senior management team that provides clear direction and leadership for the company. The company fosters a collaborative work environment based on trust and mutual respect.
cons: Not many negatives for the company. Eastman is very focused on well-define processes, which has been a key factor in its success. However, sometimes that process can prevent the nimble decision-making needed in an increasingly competitive market.

review_title: Great company that values innovation & sustainability
job_title: Integrated Global Supply Chain in Kingsport, TN
pros: Great people & work culture; Many different types of job opportunities within the company; Strong focus on Sustainability & Safety; Disciplined, data-based approach and risk analysis keeps Eastman on-track for growth (with multiple years of double-digit earnings growth as proof); Headquartered in a great location to raise a family and enjoy wide variety of activities (especially outdoor)
cons: Conservative nature of the company (although it has been identified & there has been a recent focus to look for opportunities to optimize)

review_title: Eastman Chemical is a Great Company to work for
job_title: Senior Mechanical Engineer in Kingsport, TN
pros: I've worked in several industries during my 29 year career. There have been good employers and others not so good. Currently, I am enjoying my 4th year with Eastman Chemical Company, and Eastman tops my list of all the best places to work around the country.
cons: Sometimes, Eastman can be slow to try something new or act upon a needed change. Once a course is set, however Eastman's commitment does not waiver.

pros: Eastman is a stable and committed company to the employees and community with continued growth.
cons: With said growth Eastman has lost the "Family Company" that it once had, but I'm sure any company with this type of stable growth has change to meet the demands of customers

pros:
Safety Culture helps ensure everyone goes home safely each day.
The family-like atmosphere is very conducive to work and teams are very strong.
Work-Life balance is fantastic leaving lots of time to enjoy life.
cons:
The company as a whole is fairly resistant to change.
There used to be much better benefits (even though they are still pretty good).

pros:
Ability to gain broad experience across several functional groups. 
Management recognizes hard work.
Global interaction and exposure.
Multigenerational culture.
cons:
Work/Life can be unbalanced at times due to several influences.
Certain organizations offer more flexible resources than others such as travel and team budgets.
Salary based on degree for new hires. Overlooks smaller schools and general degrees.
Application process can be difficult; feedback is limited following interviews.

pros: People at the company are very nice and friendly. It is pretty much an open door policy everywhere. Only in upper management do you start to get into corporate cronyism.
cons: Company is trying to figure out how to be a "specialty" chemical company. It seems like a lot of hype to please investors. The company is starting to care less about taking care of its people and more about pleasing THE STREET.

pros: Great support, friendly people, pleasant atmosphere, many different areas to explore for your career, work and home life balance is very good
cons: Some areas can get set in their own ways, not as forward thinking as some other companies but that is known and being worked on

pros: The work and pay are both steady and people seem to care.  There's a lot of people who want to prove themselves here.
cons: Lots of people who coast and come to collect a paycheck.  Things move slowly here and they're slow to hire, so when there are problems they tend to last for a while.

pros:
Highly ethical organizational culture
Employees work together and support each other, not a lot of competitiveness
Good compensation package, including profit sharing for all employees
Company management commitment to safety, the communities we are in, growing the business
Lots of opportunity for promotion within the company for new engineers, etc.
cons: Many manufacturing locations are in smaller communities which often do not offer the excitement, nightlife, shopping or cultural events of a bigger city.

pros: Progressive, great people to work with overall (always exceptions), very good CEO. Love the area and community. Company is doing really well now (people making good business decisions).
cons:
In general, managers need to be more candid in their reviews of employees (company working on this).
Sometimes managers overlook problem employees, especially if they get results. Or are unaware.

review_title: A great experience of opportunity and responsilbity in a variety of positions
pros:
Positive atmosphere of respect and business ethics.
Rewarded for hard work.
Opportunities to change career paths along the way.
cons:
The company is risk averse and conflict averse, which can really slow progress.  
Tends to micromanage versus empower.

pros: The company seems to be changing with the times and becoming a company that can weather financial storms.  They also seem genuinely concerned for all employees' well being and health.  Growth opportunites are available and compensation is excellent.
cons: Sometimes it takes a while to get a final decision on something.  Health insurance plan is changing but I guess that's the way some employee-sponsored healthcare plans are going these days.

pros: Lots of opportunities for chemical engineers to move around and experience different types of chemical processes and unit operations. This facilitates growth and development.  Great teamwork between all levels of the organization. Strong ethics and safety orientation.
cons: Decision making can be slow at times due to the organizational structure and risk averse culture. The area is rural, so not a lot to do if big city attractions are your preference, but it is a great place to raise a family.

pros:
Ability to follow multiple career paths at one location.  You can stay in a technical role and advance or choose management or even sales during your career.

Decent direct compensation for the area.  

The area is nice if you're not looking for a big urban experience.
cons: Health insurance isn't great.  I expect more employers will head this route, but it seems Eastman is "leading the charge."

job_title: Six Sigma Black Belt in Kingsport, TN
pros: Excellent people. As a project leader, you live and die by people's willingness to help. I have really appreciated everyone's attitude towards pitching in.
cons: We are still a little slow to adopt the "latest and greatest" whether that's in our processes or software we buy. It is getting better as the workforce changes generations.

review_title: Still a decent place to work.
pros: For several disciplines, Eastman pays the most competitive salaries in a 100 mile radius.  East Tennessee is a great place to raise a family but is still within a day trip of several major cities and beaches.
cons: Long time culture being liquidated for short term profits.  The only stakeholders that now seem to matter are major shareholders - we're looking more and more like any other factory.

pros: People are great. Work gets done, but atmosphere can be relazed. Copmany still has family values. Found surprising number of fun activities in Tri-Cities. Work life balance. Kinsport site has 3 gyms at plant. Free convenient access. Possibility to try lots of jobs without moving.
cons: Possibly pay, but life is super cheap in Kingsport. Most of discontent amount employees i found was in R&D, but exists in some other places. Might not have path to become next CEO from bottom. Who does?

review_title: Terrific company with great growth prospects and a culture that values employees.
pros: A solid company that has delivered strong financial results with good prospects for additional growth.  Eastman emphasizes employee safety, protection of the environment, and respects the communities in which it operates.
cons: Although global in operations, management of the company is largely U.S. centric.  And although strides are being made, the employee population could be more diverse.  Innovation from within also remains a struggle, although this is true for many companies.

review_title: Career employee, great company, good job security, diminishing benefits.
pros: Flexible work schedule, bonus program.
cons: Very slow advancement process, employee benefits cut year-after-year, replacing good health insurance with higher cost lower coverage health insurance.

review_title: Extraordinary Company culture, due to high level of collaboration; honesty and integrity; and winning attitude
pros:
Fair treatment of employees (non-union)
Teamwork and collaboration among employees 
Community Involvement 
Multiple career opportunities
cons: I have NO Cons relative to working for Eastman Chemical

pros: I have been employed with Eastman for 28 years. I have seen HUGE improvements over the years with respect to employee development/coaching, work/project prioritization while focusing on long-term growth and balancing short term must haves. Caring about the community and investing for the long-term.
cons: We have a lot of potential opportunities but just not enough resource to execute everything. However, over the last year the emphasis on prioritization has been positive and refreshing.

review_title: Very challenging and rewarding job for the past 20+ years
pros: The people that I have worked with over the years have been great.  We work hard together to achieve a goal but have lots of fun doing it along the way.
cons: The company needs to be faster to market by making quick decisions and accept the fact that sometimes your not always right.  We spend too much time shooting for perfection.

job_title: Market Development Manager in Kingsport, TN
pros: Eastman is a great place to work with a strong team environment and exciting, challenging assignments.  The comapny is well-managed and committed to developing talent.  Compensation, benefits, and paid time off are all excellent.  Kingsport offers easy access to countless outdoor activities and great schools.
cons: Hard to think of any.  Some people don't care for the small town environment of Kingsport, but Charlotte and Atlanta are only a few hours away.

pros: Strong company, solid performer, steady future.  This is a company that a person could plan to retire from.  Strong safety culture.
cons: Crippled by HR in some regards.  Limited opportunities and career development for non Chemical Engineers.  Individuals who leave and come back do so at higher income and salary grades than their peers.

pros: Most employees are supportive and helpful.
cons: Older/more seasoned workers are often overlooked for young employees hired straight out of college.

pros: In my 36+ years of experience with the company I have never once been put in a position where I have ever felt like I was expected to do anything or make any decision that could be considered unethical, immoral, or non-professional. In fact, the expectation is just the opposite.....always expected to do the "right thing".
cons: Most of Eastman's locations are in relatively small communities and are by far the "employer of choice" so pay and benefits are average at best.

review_title: It's a great place to work with people dedicated to helping the company succeed!
pros: Eastman has a great culture and embraces the development of its employees, regardless of their level.  Leadership has created an environment that allows employees to collaborate and bring about great thinking. The company provides pay and benefits prorgams.
cons: It's corporate headquaters is located in Kingsport, TN.  It's about a 3-4 hour drive to major ciites like Nashville, Atlanta and Charlotte.

pros: Located in a great peaceful place, good pay, great atmosphere to work in, cares about safety, cares about health and cares about family.  What else can I ask for!  I feel like I am home and that is really important.
cons: Career oportunities for some positions (people with great potential and skills) are not great.

review_title: Rewarding and fulfilling career in a beatiful area!
pros: The Eastman culture is one of the biggest assests of the company. People come to work here and stay here for decades because of the culture. Everyone is nice and helpful and we get to contribute to a company that is dedicated to sustainability and balancing work and life. There are also wonderful opportunities for training and travel.
cons: Distance from large cities, air travel from local airport means a connection to everywhere you want to go.

review_title: The combination of Eastman and Kingsport provide the ideal scenario for raising a family.
pros: Work/life balance is a high value.  Work ethic, family culture, integrity, and income potential provide a near ideal scenario for a life well-lived.
cons: Peer company competitive pressure on benefits, particularly healthcare, have recently been a negative, but the hope is that benefits will moderate to a better price point for employees.

pros:
Great managers that want to support you to reach your full potential.  Employees are hard-working, intelligent and passionate about the company and are rewarded for this with great employee benefits. 
The safety of employees is a priority for Eastman so it’s nice to know that we work for a company that genuinely cares for its employees.
cons: Can be slow to act at times.

pros: The company is very ethical and generous and has a great culture. They are very family oriented and allow for a flexibl work schedule. The employees have a great mentality and work ethic. There is a lot of room for advancement and diverse jobs that can be taken.
cons: The vision for the company is getting away from being proud of the number of employees to becoming a lean machine.

review_title: Eastman strives to be a high value, innovative company that is a friend to the community and the environment.
pros: Salary and benefits are great!  The culture is relaxed and we strive to do good work and have fun at the same time.
cons: Advancement can be limited, depending on your educational background.

pros: For the location where I work, this is the best place to work for the salary I make. The work is interesting and I have enjoyed each assignment.
cons: Workloads continue to grow as people retire. The overall cost of benefits for health care is "in-line" with other big corporations. So we are paying more for these, but isn't everyone?

pros: Eastman truly is a great place to work. If you like helping and participating in the community they provide many opportunities to help. The people are very helpful and friendly. The culture is one of growth and opportunity.
cons: Management seems to change positions every two to three years which makes it hard to get knowledge and expertise in some areas. This is not a great path for some areas such as labs, manufacturing, or anywhere technical expertise is needed.

review_title: Excellent company to work for....poised for growth
pros: Company has a long history of being successful.  Great potential for additional growth with strong cash flows.  Very capable and caring culture.
cons: Benefit plans continue to decrease in value.  Bonus plan goals are set to almost unreachable levels, so you know you will never receive more than half of the maximum allowed, despite record earnings year after year.

pros: Eastman connects talented people with challenging work in a team oriented environment.  People and results are celebrated--that is not as common in global companies as it should be.  Eastman recognizes its people as a core strength and strategic advantage.
cons: Eastman is a complex company, and it takes a while to fully understand it and appreciate the magnitude of important projects ongoing throughout the company.  It is worth the investment.

pros: Eastman is a global company with a small town feeling - it is located in Kingsport, TN. The area is beautiful - a lot of outdoor activities. Eastman provides competitive pay and opportunity to work in several different areas of the company. The company has a great culture - friendly and very caring employees.
cons: If you don't like small towns, you won't like the area. There isn't a "big city" around. However, there are plenty of outdoor activities and plenty of shopping around.

pros: I wanted to work for Eastman because it was a long established manufacturing facility with a history of employee longevity and potential to only be employed  for the remainder of my career in one extremely desirable location with advancement opportunity.
cons: The benefits have and continue to decrease for the plant role employees and the structure for hiring and retaining B&T and management employees changes very little. (raises, benefits, & bonuses)

pros: My team and supervisor are supportive, collaborative, and committed to achieving success. I feel like this is due, in part, to the atmosphere that comes from working at Eastman. There's a genuine sense of caring for employees.
cons: This is a huge company, and it can be easy to feel like you're lost in the shuffle. However, I always feel that I have meaningful work to do and that it is recognized even though I am only working part time.

review_title: Good company with a good outlook
pros: They pay well for the area.  Management listens and treats their employees well.  Flexible schedules for day personnel.
cons: It seems hard to advance without an Engineering degree.  The benefits are declining in value as with most companies today.

pros: Pay is very good for this area (Kingsport, TN).  There are some awesome people working here.
cons: Benefits are changing almost yearly.  The benefits may still be competitive to other companies, but they are not as good as they used to be.

job_title: Human Resources Business Partner in East Kingsport, TN
pros: There's no better place to work than this Co. Not taking pay -you'll get richer faster elsewhere- but the principles based culture. This' an ethical Company !. And that's priceless now a days
cons: We can be slow. But not because we're lazy, but because we try to connect the dots and find the not so obvious consequences of what we'll do. We take our Company, our Community our employees seriously

review_title: Good company and outlook for the near future
job_title: Advanced Development Engineer in Kingsport, TN
pros: I think Eastman is a good company with a promising future.  I feel like there is good job security as long as you are a good contributor.  Also, the focus on diversifying the portfolio and looking ahead is just what the company needs to stay on top.
cons: At times the layers and layers of processes can get in the way of getting real work done.

review_title: Missing the "old" Eastman when there actually cared about their employees.
job_title: Chemical Plant Operator in Kingsport, TN
pros: One of the better paying places in the area.
cons: Benefits are no longer "good", cut vacation time, retirement and insurance benefits.  They no longer care about the people, especially the operators doing the actual work.  Contracting lots of jobs out and getting rid of older employees jobs just to turn about and hire younger workers to replace them.   Becoming safety stupid.......

review_title: A company with a good outlook and competitive compensation located in a small town.
job_title: Advanced Systems Analyst in Kingsport, TN
pros: Very competitive pay and benefits.  I've been presented with exciting, challenging and fun opportunities with Eastman from time to time.  Work/Life balance is stressed by upper management.
cons: I feel like the company could be more transparent about rationale behind decisions that will be disapointing to employees.  Work/Life balance is frequently just lip service when it comes to direct management.

review_title: I am happy and proud to be part of a successfull company who values its employees
pros:
A caring company which gives employees the oppurtunity to grow. 
Great to work with so many international colleagues and their different cultures.
Have never experienced issues when asking for time off.
Am treated equally and well by upper management.
cons:
A lot is expected of you, work can be busy and stressfull.
We often experience challenges. Employees need to be flexible.

review_title: A great place to work with lots of opportunity!
pros: Eastman invests in their employees from training opportunities to showing appreciation to a set of checks and balances to make sure you are getting rewarded for your good work.
cons: The workplace culture places a lot of emphasis on years with the company which makes it hard for newer employees to merit their work.

pros: Unlike some companies, all employees at Eastman truly want their co-workers to succeed. It is easy to get things done because everyone has a similar attitude and work ethic. There are plenty of opportunities for international travel or advancement within the company. Eastman has a strong emphasis on safety and innovation.
cons: One obvious downside is that world headquarters is in Kingsport, TN, about four hours from both Nashville and Atlanta. It's a beautiful area though, with many outdoor activities nearby.

pros: Eastman has an excellent company culture, great teamwork between team members, very good job security, and interesting / challenging work.  Overall, Eastman is a great place to work.
cons: Career advancement opportunities are very good, but can be somewhat limited on the technical side at the higher technical levels.

review_title: Eastman's Culture is Second to None
pros: Eastman's culture is very collaborative.  I enjoy challenging projects across various businesses within Eastman.  My colleagues are open with sharing information as well as learning from each other.
cons: Eastman is one of the biggest employers in the area.  If you relocate, your significant other may have some difficulties finding employment.

pros: Specialty chemical company with strong emphasis on innovation and technical service support. Eastman holds #1 or #2 positions in the markets it targets.
cons: Growing pains, but we'll be stronger for it. Combining the cultures of Solutia and Eastman will yield benefits down the road.

pros: co-workers and supervisors care about your feedback, they give back to the community, they have health incentives example: they reimburst a qualifying gym cost, they're big on having a safe work environment, "they want you to leave work the same as you came in".
cons: lot of mandatory overtime, slim chance of changing departments(job) they only give two chances per year, 12 hour swingshift (get every other weekend off),

review_title: Great place to start and end a career
job_title: Entry Level Systems Analyst in Kingsport, TN
pros:
- They care about their employees
- They will help you fuel your own success
- They want you to be excited about the work that you do
cons:
- Sometimes things can get lost in translation
- if there are many new hires, then training can be difficult to schedule with your mentor

review_title: Wrong leaders in positions  and bad decisions on way!
pros: Pay and has provided my family a decent living.
cons: Changing but decision makers don't know what they are doing. No experience in leader roles. Morale so low in most organizations. Scary times ahead!

pros: Great flexible hours and very competitive pay. Very family oriented company and they are willing to go the extra mile to work with the employee with any family issues. Everyone is very respectful, and it is not a cut-throat working environment.
cons: The health benefits could be better for new employees. Performance rating structure will not guarantee a performance driven culture.

pros: Ability to work in multiple jobs throughout career without having to relocate; great wealth of knowledge across the company that individuals are happy to share with one another; community service is highly supported and encouraged; healthy lifestyles encouraged and work-life balance easy to maintain
cons: Benefits are shrinking to meet benchmarking; culture is becoming more competitive as bonuses/raises are based on comparitive performance with peers

review_title: My 20+ years at Eastman have been both challenging and rewarding.
pros:
Great culture for doing things right.
Invests well in people to develop them to their full potential.
Current executive team is making smart decisions.
Most locations are in areas well suited for developing a family
cons: Some younger employees may be turned off by the locations which are usually smaller metropolitan areas.

review_title: Eastman is a company that values its employees and their knowledge as true assets.
pros: Eastman cares about safety, sustainability, innovation, the environment, its stakeholders as well as its employees and their overall health and happiness.
cons: Eastman is so diverse and spread out throughout the World that it is often difficult to really understand the magnitude of the company itself, or all the markets that it is involved in.

review_title: I wish I were 20 years younger and could really enjoy the refreshing change from the days of Solutia.
pros: A fair, honest, consistent, equitable company compared to our last one. So far a great place to work.
cons: Moves fairly slow on decisions but that is not necessarily a bad thing.

pros: Supportive work environment as a result of which its possible to achieve "work-life balance" most of the time.  Promotions not so easy to come by, but hard work will not go unnoticed.
cons: Management and HR tends to be conservative when having to make a tough decision based on complaints.  Not known to take a tough stand.

review_title: Culture of inclusion that results in optimism for the future
pros: Management is willing to give project responsibility to those willing to take on the challenge. The culture is one where everyone plays on the same team. Your co-workers want to see you succeed in your endeavors and expect the same respect in return.
cons: Eastman is a company that is headquartered in a small town and has an aging employment base. Often times ideas can be restricted due to "old school" mindsets.

job_title: Integrated Global Supply Chain in Kingsport, TN
pros: For over 30 years Eastman has offered me challenging and diverse professional opportunities. Its culture of teamwork, ethics and high responsibility make it one of the best companies on the planet.  Make no mistake, Eastman expects exceptional performance. However, it is rewarding to be part of a winning team.
cons: Work life balance is skewed a bit toward work at present. That is recognized and is being actively addressed to put more emphasis on wellness and well being.

job_title: Process Operator in Saint Gabriel, LA
pros: Salary on par for area.
cons: We just got bought out by Eastman! We had great insurance and 401k match with Tamico. Did I mention HAD! We know have major medical!!! I call 6k deductible major medical!!! They also cut our 401k match in half!!! We are being forced to change our shift schedule basically because the payroll department in Tenn is lazy!! Also took 2 vacation days away!! If you do not live in the mangers home town you will not get promoted!!!!!! Here at are plant we don't have a real HR person!! I have only saw someone in HR 3 times in 5 years!!

review_title: Good ole boys and yes men
pros: Kingsport is a beautiful area and a great place to live if you like small towns and enjoy the outdoors.  The cost of living is low.  Eastman allows a flexible work 9/80 work schedule with half days on Friday if the supervisor agrees to it and if you're lucky enough to finish enough of your work to feel that you may leave early.
cons:
Often it is not about what you know or what you contribute, instead those that know the right people and talk a good game (without even doing good work) are the ones that tend to be recognized and promoted.   Many managers are more interested in advancing their careers than growing the individuals under them.  This leads to them kissing up to their management chain, while those under them are doing the hard work and not getting recognized.  Employees' true feelings and different perspectives are not encouraged; the executive leadership team and many of the managers only want to hear ideas from those that think just like them, or say what they want to hear.  

Managers also rotate out of their positions on average about every 3 years, which means they can't coach their employees to be more successful because they don't have enough time to get to know them.  Many managers seem to treat women with less respect than men.  Women are afraid to announce pregnancies for fear of being penalized for it.  Some women have been accused of doing lower quality work because they have children.  Eastman has too many layers of management.  This leads to employees spending more time explaining/justifying what they do, rather than doing “real” work.  It also encourages micromanaging and not trusting employees to do the jobs they were hired to do.  

Morale is at an all time low.  Two layoffs occurred in 2016.  In the second round, good talent was purged.  The stability that was once found at Eastman is gone.  Employees are at risk of being let go, regardless of their ability to perform.  Forcing employees to fit on a distribution curve (meaning someone has to be on the bottom) for pay raises and promotions is also decreasing the morale which is demotivating employees, especially since there are not good checks and balances to ensure that managers are ranking employees on actual performance rather than just the manager's perception of the performance.
