review_title: Eastman a great place to buidl a career
job_title: Vice President Technology in Kingsport, TN
pros: The people, the culture and the vision for our company are all reasons I feel blessed to work for Eastman.  Recent financial success of the company positions us well for continued growth and investment.  Eastman has demonstrated a commitment to innovation.
cons: The pace of work and the balance of work and family is challenged at times.

review_title: Great place to work and raise a family
pros: You have the opportunity to work in multpile organizations and responsibilities without leaving Kingsport. The company has a strong presence in the community, and the copany is a strong supporter of having a work life balance.
cons: As a company that has a very strong analytical base, we sometimes rely too much on process and templates to determine if we are doing something the right way.

review_title: I have nothing but positive things to say about my employer, Eastman Chemical.
pros: This is a great company to be a part of because they know their core values and work towards them every day. I feel like everyone tries to come together as a team for the success of the group. And I love that they support employee training opportunities for growth.
cons: Compensation increases have been low the last couple of years.

review_title: Long term career.  Very positive overall
pros: Great people and a great corporate headquarters.  Many of the people are long time employees.   It seems that once you come to work for Eastman many (most) chose to stay for a career.
cons: If you must travel, flight schedules into local airport can be limiting, but I'll tade that inconvience for my 7 minute commute every day..  (7.5 minutes during rush hour)

review_title: Innovation Driven Culture where Creativity, Sharing Ideas, and Openness are Promoted
pros: This is a great place for work for multiple reasons. Some of them are: great location, excellent amicable and friendly ambience, innovation driven culture, and great work-life balance.
cons: Innovation prospers with  openness embraced with optimism. Still few people are not open to new ideas. But that number is very low compared to enthusiastic people.

review_title: Great place to work.  Kingsport, TN is a great place to live too
pros: Eastman has a great culture that is collaborative, friendly, and high integrity.  Pay is good.  Jobs are relatively stable.  Company has had several record years in recent past.  Lots of opportunity.
cons: The employee performance rating management system is de-motivating. Also the high performance environment can be very stressful depdning on job function.

pros: Opportunities to make a difference. Growth. Volunteer spirit. A good plan to keep growing. Still has good healthcare and savings options.
cons: Must be a self starter to get ahead. Still too male dominated at the executive level.

review_title: Why I still work at Eastman after more than 20 years
pros: Strong safety and environmental commitment. Nice places to live. Great co-workers.
cons: Manufacturing can only cost cut for so many years before being forced to take unacceptable risks. Safety comes first but how do you compare growth versus critical reliability projects?

review_title: DO NOT work here.   Tanking, bloated company
job_title: Inside Sales Representative in Kingsport, TN
pros: Easy job.  Decent pay.  Good starter job.
cons: Management is decades behind competition and unwilling to change.  Managers are not good at dealing with conflict.   Very very top heavy company who can’t make decisions.

pros: There are some good technical people who actually care about the work.
cons: Good people are being pushed out by the medicore and mundane.

pros: Family culture for the most part was good and the employee benefits was above average for the area.  Community relations is excellent.
cons: Top heavy management that doesn't acknowledge the average working Joe's abilities and work ethic.

review_title: Eastman Chemical, Great Company to Work For!
pros:
- Integration between the Manufacturing, Engineering, and Financial divisions
- Ability to move between business (P&L) jobs and business support jobs; career path variety
- Very competitive salary packages
- Culture is very collaborative; and management is open to new ideas from non-management contributors 
- Growth company
cons: - HQ is located in a smaller city as opposed to outside a large city, although this might be very appealing

review_title: Great and Challenging Place to Work
pros: The company offers great pay, competitive benefits and is always making sure they are comparable to their peers in those respects.  Management allows for team members to be innovative and encourages everyone to express their views.  The job is a challenge and is always pushing you to become a better employee.
cons: The decision making process can take a little longer than at other companies.

job_title: Senior Associate Scientist in Kingsport, TN
pros: Travel to meeting is general
cons: Managers are of a different technical background then the people doing the work (which is often normal) yet managers because they are managers feel obligated to micromanage how the work is completed despite adding no value in stead of simply directing what work is needed.

pros:
*The demonstration of great Leadership as can be seen in year over year results
*Personal growth through challenging assignments
*Global footprint
*Growing through acquisitions and R&D
cons: The greatest opportunity is improvements in workload balance

pros:
Company values (safety, teamwork, ethical behavior) are clear throughout the company - top to bottom
Working in locations that were great places to work as well as great places to live and raise a familty
Having the opportunities to change career paths and opportunities without having to "job hop" across the country
cons: Risk averse culture slows our growth

review_title: Looking back at my decision to Join Eastman 14 years ago it was the right one!  Given the chance I'd not change a thing.
pros: Flexible work environment allowing me to keep my family as a top priority, and yet have a productive and rewarding career.
cons: Communication, but that is a challenge in any larger company.  Eastman leverages the latest technology to minimize the issue.

review_title: People of the highest moral quality.
pros: Ethics, social care and sustainability. Managers are really there to enable your activities.
cons: Doing the right thing is not always easy, but it is a basic rule in this company.

review_title: Uncertainty prevails if you are/haven't worked at Kingsport, TN
pros: Job stability, lot of experienced professional to help
cons: Slow to make decisions, biased if you are not at Kingsport, TN

pros: Immediate coworkers are a pleasure to work with. Benefits are good. People genuinely care about each other. Environment to work is very good.
cons: Upper management is clueless. No growth and coworkers are always worried about losing jobs, office closing, etc. You can do excellent work in the same position for years without being noticed.

review_title: Great company,  with a great family based environment.
pros: Several opportunities for all trades in support of one mission. Everyone promotes safety and well being of fellow employees through all aspects of the job.
cons: Keeping up with the curve and advances with constant training could be the most frustrating part of anything that you work on because Eastman stays up to date with the most efficient and timely way to process natural gas.

review_title: Great place to have a career!
pros: Positive culture and embraces positive change.  Eastman has made a lot of positive changes on product and market mix to move toward a more profitable growth environment, and this has become obvious through improvement in stock prices.
cons: Must be comfortable with small town environment for HQ assignment, but it's a great place to live.

pros: Team oriented environment allows for sharing of ideas and collaboration amongst workforce. This idea is entity wide and truly shows the "tone at the top."
cons: Being based out of a small town provides unique opportunities as well as challenges. Overall, this plays to a strength for the Company.

review_title: Eastman has offered me a diverse set of challenges in my career that have resulted in personal growth and a lot of fun.
pros: The culture is one of team alignment that remains competitive.  But competition is in the marketplace, not amongst coworkers.
cons: Historically, Eastman had been slow to recognize the pace of change necessary to win.  But most the organization is embracing the commitment needed to change our future.

review_title: Eastman is a great place to work
job_title: Integrated Global Supply Chain in Kingsport, TN
pros: We are a team that works together to get things done correctly and on time.  Enviroment promotes/encourages team work.  Career advancement opportunities.  Everyone is encouraged to do their best.   Supervision really care about you and your job.
cons: Work schedule not always as flexible as it could be.

review_title: Great experience over the long haul
pros: Very inclusive team-oriented culture; lot's of opportunity for multiple career experiences (e.g. exploring various functions/positions that are differ from your entry position)
cons: As the company grows and competes for talent, some consideration will likely need to be given to enhancing the already competitive benefits package.   Some evidence of willingness to do this is already manifesting.

job_title: Senior Vice President in Hong Kong
pros: The company is focused on innovation, productivity, performance and growth, not just of the company but employees as well.  The company treats employees fairly and well, particularly high performers and high potential employees.
cons: Given the global footprint, it is a relatively more diverse and challenging place to work.  However, it is a good place for top talents looking to gain a global perspective to work.

review_title: Great company to work for , lots of opportunity for personal growth. Eastman values their employees!
pros: Diverse work group. Lots of opportunity for growth. The company has strong Structured Training Programs and will offer financial assistance to continue higher education.
cons: Cost of insurance for the rank and file has increased. Compensation in the way of bonuses and incentives are somewhat one-sided favoring upper managment vs. Rank and file employees.

review_title: Good company to work for in the area.
pros: Pay is good and opportunities for advancement are good.  Vacation and company paid holidays are awesome!  Are very flexible on work schedules which is very important with family.
cons: Health care is changing and wont be as good but probably as good as other companies.  We still have good retirement benefits and get a yearly bonus.

review_title: Positive employment with a chance of promotion.
pros: The company is forward-thinking, willing to embrace new technologies and philosophies, and always strives to develop itself into something more successful.
cons: The company is young and sometimes over-eager.  The personnel changes in leadership roles work against maintaining consistency on the path to long-term development.

pros: The people at Eastman are great. I have fantastic coworkers and love that everyone is so willing to help each other. The work life balance is also very good as are opportunities for career movement within the company.
cons: Because of the team-oriented culture, sometimes meetings can overwhelm your calendar making it difficult to get other work done, but all in all, I have no real complaints.

review_title: Family friendly, challenging place to work.
pros: Great team work and ability for people to work together.  Many opportunities to enjoy a wide ranging career without being displaced.  Opportunities to work globally if desired.   Very ethical company.
cons: Not aggressive enough in pursuing new market opportunities.  Can at times be more of a follower instead of a leader.

pros: We have great people that work here.  Everyone works together as one big team.  Our pay is competitive to the surrounding chemical plants.
cons: Over the last few months we have been transitioning from Taminco Inc. to Eastman Chemical.  There have been close to zero positive changes.  Once Eastman began to take over, moral has been quick to plummet.  Our medical benefits are not so much a benefit at all.  Our PPO plans have been totally eliminated and replaced with a high deductible plan which is not suitable for all employees lifestyles.  It is the absolute worst medical plan I've seen in my career.  Previously, we were given three personal choice holidays (used like vacations days).  Now, we only have one.  This is only a benefit to staff who do not work a rotating shift.  They will still get the holiday off while shift workers will be required to work.  Even though we will be paid, we wont actually be "off" enjoying the "holiday."  We want out three days back to enjoy time with our families too.  Everyone loved our shift rotation until Eastman came to town.  They had to modify that too.  Now we aren't off Friday through Sunday (like most surrounding plants) because someone thought it would be easier for us to change our lives instead of how payroll works.  We are now off Saturday though Monday.  And retirement?  That's a joke.  Its been cut too.  In conclusion, Eastman has created nothing but turmoil in this work place.  The people are unhappy and are considering other options.  We are the new revolving door in town.

pros: It's great to work for a company who demonstrates a caring attitude for their employees. While some employees don't believe we have good benefits, I do. I've had previous jobs with other companies which really helps me to appreciate the working environment and benefits at Eastman.
cons: Lack of avenues to share constructive feedback with upper management.

pros: Good salary, challenging projects, great coworkers
cons: Poorly trained management, harassment, lack of opportunities for advancement, extreme favoritism

job_title: Systems Analyst in Johnson City, TN
pros: Great work experience and opportunities for future development, especially in IT. They invest a good amount into their interns, and you learn about the work criteria of the department.
cons: Not many serious cons as an intern. If you live in JC, the commute is somewhat decent. They are doing less with carrying over vacation days to the next year.

review_title: Great if your in upper tier ,sorry if your salary
pros: Been with the company for 35 years , 30 good years
cons: Company cutting benefits at every opportunity (Vacation,Bonus,Health care)

pros: Low cost of living in the Tri-Cities area, competitive salary and benefits.  Eastman is a good place where to get started in the industry as a scientist.
cons: Lack of advancement, some discrimination, minorities and women have not yet been fully appreciated.  Promotions are based on who you know than what you do. Monotonous work as a scientist.

pros: The company maintains high standards for honesty and ethical behavior.   Most managers genuinely care about the development and well-being of their employees.  One can have very diverse assignments over the course of a career.
cons: Can be slow to act due to a combination of matrix organization structure, a desire for consensus, business management processes,  and decisions being elevated higher than necessary.

job_title: Supply Chain Manager in Kingsport, TN
pros: People at Eastman are very knowledgable, smart and willing to share! Eastman values teamwork and holds high standard on integrity.
cons: Motivation system and process need to be revised to keep up with the speed the company is growing at. Engagement of employees at all level needs to be enhanced.

review_title: My experience at Eastman has been very good.
pros: It's a great place to work with a nice work/life balance.  There are lots of opportunities to move up and advance.
cons: The only challenges are getting people to move to Kingsport.  The company is centered in Kingsport and working to be a more global company.

job_title: Advanced Research Scientist in Kingsport, TN
pros: I have worked at Eastman for over 30 years, and if I knew then what I knew now, I wouldn't hesitate to start again.  Great people and great projects over the years.  I look forward to coming to work every day.
cons: Some of the programs developed to enhance performance can be distracting.

review_title: Company that foremost values its people
pros: At Eastman, the management makes an effort to ensure that the employee find meaning in their work..
cons:
Eastman should make a stronger effort to create a brand value.
Eastman should try to aggressively recruit candidates from top-tier universities (especially in Technology) outside the TN-NC-SC area.

pros: I've been with Eastman almost 25 years.  I've had a variety of challenging jobs during that time, which has kept my career fresh the entire time
cons: The pace can be pretty intense at times- hard to get away at times.  That being said, my management always tries to encourage me to get away.  I've consistently been treated well over my time here.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Roan Mountain, TN
pros:
- Work/Life flexibility
- Opportunities in multiple areas
- Rotational assignments to build skills and gain exposure to different areas of the business
cons:
- Change is a constant as the company is refocusing on specialty markets as opposed to commodity
- The workplace environment is very conservative and decisions are made by consensus, slowing down the rate at which decisions are made
- Lack of cohesive focus and vision from the top down

pros: Salaryes are at market or better, co-workers are qualified and friendships are easily forged. Facilities are kept clean and organized. 401 k is offered and portable
cons: Risk-averse culture where misses could be costly. Benefit plans don't keep pace with competitors. Not much work life balance as competitors.

pros: The people are the best! Great collaborative culture. Many people are true, high performers.
cons: Work life balance at director level and up. I work a lot on weekends to catch up. Also, roles merge and there is little compensation adjustment, even with increased responsibilities and team size.

pros: Steady employment for a long term career. Rare these days!
cons: If you are in a position working swingshift it is difficult, but otherwise a great place to work.  Most jobs are day jobs.

job_title: Process Improvement Engineer in Longview, TX
pros: Eastman hires only the best and expects a lot of you. Everyone I worked with, especially management, was outstanding. I felt challenged, valued, and well compensated for my time. If you get the chance to work for Eastman, jump on it!
cons: Most of the PI offices are not located within the plant (to increase safety), making communication with operations more difficult and slows down progress on projects.

job_title: Six Sigma Black Belt in Kingsport, TN
pros: Eastman is an employer that cares about their employees Health, Safety, and Productivity. They offer multiple programs to enhance one's development personally and professionally. It's refreshing to be part of an authentic culture which fosters collaboration and growth not only within the company, but within the industry and local community.
cons: There are no cons I can think of that hold enough weight to mention.

review_title: It gives my great pride to work for a company that is so involved with the community that surrounds the company.
pros: Community involvement, world class organization, people are caring, pay is excellent, continual investment into the company's future, the drive to always get better.
cons: Eastman is grwoing rapidly, and that causes lots of change.

review_title: Working at Eastman has been a great experience. I feel like Eastman treats me as a person not just a number.
pros: Eastman places value on the employees and rewards their employees for hard work and dedication.  Eastman has advancement opportunities as well as programs in place to develop the skills need to advance.
cons: The health care benefit is more expensive than it was when I came to Eastman.

pros: Job stability is a plus, pay and benefits are decent for this area, company values are strong and incorporated at every level, time off policies are fairly generous.  Safety is very strong, and internalized down to the lowest level.
cons: Advancement opportunities are limited based on roles; culture is not particularly standard across the company; safety culture is top notch, but balancing could become a problem.

review_title: One of the best places to work
job_title: Advanced Chemical Engineer in Kingsport, TN
pros: Amazing collaborative culture, good mentoring habbits for new employees and fresh graduates, nurturing environment and very competitve. Excellent work life balance and the benefits are decent. Lots of oppurtunities for training and personal growth
cons: being a growing company diversity is a fairly new concept. Being a global company, management can spend some time teaching its employees about diversity and immigration in particular.

review_title: Not a bad place to work until you get older
pros:
Steady work and steady paycheck. Most of the co-workers are nice, good hard working people. 
Decent benefits. Salary is okay.
cons: Seems like the longer you are here, the less they care about you. You can give you all and a little more but once you get a little older, it seems like they want you out the door.

review_title: Ethical company who values its stakeholders
job_title: Marketing Communications Coordinator in Kingsport, TN
pros: Excellent executive leadership. Talented and creative work environment.
cons: Lack of career opportunities for employees without a degree.

pros: Eastman has a caring, responsible culture. There is truly a team feeling in this work environment. People do not hesitate to help one another regardless of their work area.

review_title: Senior SAP SD-MM Lead Functional Consultant
job_title: Senior SAP SD-MM Lead Functional Consultant in Kingsport, TN

review_title: Stop the cutbacks and work with employees on how to run the company in this difficult economic times.

cons: Second round of cutbacks demoralize an already over worked group.  I don't feel confident that I'll have a job in the future and this brings out unnecessary stress and frustration.

pros: Eastman Chemical is a very friendly, comfortable place.  It is in a beautiful setting in NE TN.  Management is very solid and professional.  Business is good as is the outlook for the next few years.
cons: The culture of the area is very small town south - polite but very conservative, so it's not for everyone.  Diversity could use some more work.

review_title: Eastman stands for safety, quality, and high performance.

Eastman is a large company.  Large companies offer advancement opportunities if you are patient.
Eastman rewards outperformance.
cons:
Eastman is a large company.  Employees often don't see how their contributions impact the bottom line.
Eastman wants outperformance from every employee.

pros: Very supportive management staff who encourages and enables employees to be creative. The company has a great safety record as well as providing many onsite health and wellness opportunities. Employees are consistently treated with respect and recognized for their individual contributions.
cons: Honestly, I cannot think of a reason not to appreciate working for Eastman.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Jefferson Hills, PA

pros: Wonderful people who take their jobs seriously and always maintain the highest ethical behavior. They are results-oriented and performance driven; however, they look out for each other and are always willing to help.
cons: Can be very bureacratic and advancement can take years.

pros: Great culture, interesting and challenging work, development opportunities, competitive pay, fantastic people, and a solid state of the business.

pros: The company really made the transition from college to full time employment very smooth and painless. My mentor is really great to work with and everyone seems very invested in making sure that I am feeling comfortable and welcome to the area.

pros: Great pay, stable work and family friendly. Flexible hours. Growing company.
cons: Wants to be industry leader but has resently reduced some benefits. Be an industry leader and out do the competition in the benefits area. Money is only a part of the compensation for a lifetime of work experience.

review_title: Eastman Chemical was one of the best places I've ever worked.
pros: Eastman has one of the friendliest environments out there. It's easy to feel like work is more of a project with friends rather than co-workers. It's a really great place to work.

review_title: The greatest decision I have ever made!!

Great work environment

 Attitude and ethics

review_title: A very professional company with endless oportunity.

review_title: takes years to move to abetter position

review_title: Eastman has a employee focus with a teamwork culture. I feel like I work with my co-workers, not competing against them.

pros: Eastman has a good work/family balance. It's a good feeling to know I can take time to work with family concerns when needed.

review_title: Great place to work while raising a family!

pros: Eastman has extremely well qualified staff.  The people are very pleasant.  The portfolio is growing organically and by acquisitions.  It is a great place to work!

pros: Eastman has a very collaborative culture that fosters team work and innovation, management is engaged and willing to look at new ideas and suggestions that will move the company forward. pros: Decent benefits and alternative work schedules are allowed.

review_title: Eastman Chemical Company is top notched employer

review_title: It is an honor and pleasure to be an employee of Eastman Chemical.

Eastman is committed to greatness.  Being simply good is not acceptable.
Health and Wellness is an integral part of what we are and do.
Eastman has a vision for the future and where we want to go with a clear path to get there.
cons: There are no real issues.

review_title: Great Company to work for with endless opportunities for growth.

cons: Very competative for employment opportunities. The amount of time to reach top pay eventhough all requirements are met is a little extensive.

review_title: Eastman is a great place to work and employees are friendly and willing to help you succeed!

pros: Dynamic company with great products! Eastman products are everywhere in our daily lives and it is great to be part of that. I am proud to be working at Eastman! Great people, great opportunities! Good salaries and other benefits.

job_title: Reliability Management Facilitator in Longview, TX

cons: Benefits and salaries are at the median for the area, they need to be improved in order to entice better applicants, and to retain current employees.

pros: I've been with the company quite awhile and am appreciative.   The experiences are good. No company is perfect and in my tenure here I've seen a lot of changes.  They are more about the money now like most large corporations and not so much about the employees

pros: Supportive work environment, beautiful location, smooth onboarding process, many opportunities to engage with the community, great work-life balance, nice small town to live in.
cons: The rural environment may not be for everybody.  However, there are a few cities nearby, including Knoxville and Asheville with plenty to do.  There is also a very convenient airport if you need to travel elsewhere!

pros: Eastman was a fantastic company to spend a summer with in the intern program. Everyone there is willing to share their knowledge and advice (of which there is a lot!) and you learn a ton.
cons: The location is not for everyone, as most out of work activities involve the outdoors.

pros: Pay, coworkers, available overtime (when not slow), safety and training, having good and reliable equipment and tools to work with.
cons: Management is clueless and undercuts the lower employees. Management also gets switched around so much they try to change where they are moved to and it doesn't work

pros: Eastman is a growing comapnay and has a lot of opportunities for their employees. Develops employees. Staying focus on their goals. The company values their employees and keeps them informed of how the company is performing.
cons: Lower grade jobs are being contracted out and there seems to be a lot of turn over in these people.

review_title: Eastman has continually challenged me and as a result has given me the opportunity to grow the company and myself
